page.title: 09CHANGING TIMES IN DUNSTABLE
page.content: Since 1905 the population of Dunstable has increased five fold.In 1935 the main for of transport were bicycles.At this time,the majority of council houses were to be found on one estate,and there were a few small shops.A.C. Delco was built in the 1930's and the expansion of Dunstable began,though the greatest changes started after the 2nd World War.In 1960 there were more pubs than in 1930 because one each new estate that was built,a new pub was built in 1964.This was followed,in the early 80's by a smaller one called Ashton Square.In 1964 Church St was widened to allow more traffic,and recently the traffic lights at the major crossroads were replaced by a complex roundabout.
